fails on following error trying to compile "xlate.c":

xlc_r -g -qHALT=E -qfullpath -qinitauto=FE -qcheck=all -qinfo=pro   -

2.0.48/srclib/apr-util/include -I/opt/freeware/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr-
util/include/private  -I/opt/freeware/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr/include  -
I/opt/freeware/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib  -c xlate.c && touch 
xlate.lo

text:
Oops...  APR attempts to autodetect which flavor of iconv() is used, but that
for some reason was not used for AIX and Solaris.  AIX platform changed the decl
for iconv() between AIX 5.1 and AIX 5.2, so the hard-coded information is
invalid on 5.2.

Please edit srclib/apr/build/apr_hints.m4, find this line in the AIX section

APR_SETIFNULL(apr_iconv_inbuf_const, [1])

delete it, re-run buildconf, configure, etc.

Alternate:
edit srclib/apr-util/include/private/apu_config.h and comment out this line:
#define APU_ICONV_INBUF_CONST 1
then re-run make

use the second work-around suggested... first work-around suggested was incomplete

a fix has been committed and will be in httpd 2.0.next

thanks for your report, and thanks for using Apache httpd!
